Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one thng about the dice I didnt really write much about is the entropy source. each bet has 2 entropy sources

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the one from the house account, which has the hash of it added to the opreteurn and the dicebet that adds it directly to the opreturn. this allows the hous account to immediately know if it wins or loses and it processes it in realtime

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @SHossain awesome, thanks! that gdoc made it very straightforward to write tests when I didn't really know much about CC, well done ðŸ‘

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in the event a house account tries to cheat by not dicefinish for winning bets, ie. trying to not payout. when the dice plan's expiration happens, it is treated as a win and anybody can complete the dicefinish

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: when the dicefinish completes a bet for either win or loss, it attaches the original entropy value so the hash of it can be verified. in other words it is provably fair and random for each and every bet. the dicebet is the one that chooses what house entropy to use, so that alone gives the power to determine the outcome to the dicebettoer. and as long as the bettor's entropy is a high entropy value, the outcome is totally random

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: technically I generate 2 256 bit numbers from the two entropy values. I just SHA256(house entropy + bettor entropy) for the house and SHA256(bettor entropy + house entropy) for the bettor. Then for odds of > 1, the entropy value is divided by the odds and the two numbers compared. the bettor value adjusted by odds needs to be bigger than the house value

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I think the payout matches the risk. for a 1:1, the two values are directly compared and a win is 2x what was bet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since there is a 50% chance, the expected result is 50% of 2x or 1x

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at 2:1 odds, the hash value is divided in 2, so it seems that the odds of winning are 1 out of 3 and a win is 3x, so it seems to work
